revised_title: Health Hazards of Mineral Dusts and Asbestos-Related Diseases
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Environmental Health
tldr: This article discusses the health hazards caused by mineral dusts, focusing on the induction of cancers, particularly in relation to asbestos fibers. It highlights the importance of dose, particle size, and shape in determining the health risks associated with mineral dust exposure. The author also explains the methods used to detect and measure these risks, emphasizing the need for further research to ensure the safe use of man-made mineral fibers.
